test-case.name: position-1703
test-case.description: Node Set Functions. Test of recursive '[position()>1]' optimizations. this is a variant of pos63 in which the expression $nodes[1] is replaced by a numeric expression whose value (and indeed type) is not known statically. This takes a different (and difficult) path through the FilterExpression code

result.assert-xml: <out><x length="3" stack="d c b" stack1="d" stack2="c" stack3="b" stack-2-="c b" /><x length="2" stack="c b" stack1="c" stack2="b" stack3="" stack-2-="b"/></out>

test-case.name: position-5801
test-case.description: FileName: position48 Document: http://www.w3.org/TR/xslt DocVersion: 19991116 Section: 10

source.content: <?a-pi some data?> <?b-pi some data?> <doc> test </doc> <?c-pi some data?>

result.assert-xml: <out>HERE 1. we 2. found 3. the 4. rest 5. of 6. the 7. tree</out>

source.content: A1B1A2A3B2 A4A5

result.assert-xml: <out>B2, B2, B2; A5, A5; This is the 2nd comment , </out>

test-case.name: position-6701
test-case.description: FileName: position77 Document: http://www.w3.org/TR/xslt DocVersion: 19991116 Section: 5.4

result.assert-xml: <out> Title= BBB<name last-of="2">section</name> Title= CCC<name last-of="3">section</name> Title= EEE<name last-of="4">section</name></out>

test-case.name: position-7901
test-case.description: FileName: position94 Document: http://www.w3.org/TR/xslt DocVersion: 19991116 Section: 11.6

result.assert-xml: <out>6 nodes on this axis: Root Node E: far-north E: north E: near-north E: center A: center-attr-3 </out>
<out>5 nodes on this axis: Root Node E: far-north E: north E: near-north E: center </out>
